user.biography: The culmination of travel and insight, of friendships and explorations, and of realizing a sense of one's place.

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Hill Farmstead Brewery in Hill Farmstead Brewery with @outrightvermont, and @katewisecocktails. May be an image of nature and sky.

node.text:
As we reach the threshold of Labor Day weekend and an all-too-short summer waves faintly from the rearview mirror, we look ahead to autumn in Vermont. Cooler nights, shorter days, the arrival of foliage.

Beginning this coming week, our hours will shift slightly for the bottle shop, now opening at 11:30 a.m. (still closing at 5 p.m.). We are exploring expanding our reservation time to match that, so stay tuned to our Tock site for possible openings. Additional spots generally become available on Monday at 5 p.m. for the same week, but with the holiday, stay tuned on Tuesday.

Continuing throughout September, we will donate $1 for each draft pour in our taproom to Outright Vermont in support of its essential services for at-risk LGBTQ+ youth. September is Vermont Pride month, and Outright Vermont is an indispensable, state-wide non-profit that works to shape a safe, equitable state for all LGBTQ+ youth. 

Follow #DrinkItForward for other participating locations and ways you can support the organization (@outrightvermont), and if you join us in the taproom, tag a photo of us with #DrinkItFoward to show your support.

Our bottle shop will be stocked with cans of Citra® Pale Ale; Susan, our India Pale Ale; Edward, our American Pale Ale; and Mary (brewed with organic malted barley). Bottle selections will include Pear: 2020 Harvest; Nonconformist 02; Arthur: Cascade; Florence: Puncheon; Cherry/Raspberry: 2019 Harvest; Barrel-Aged Lemon Cello; and Barrel-Aged Wachu Saison.

The same-day online order window will continue at toasttab.com/hillfarmstead at 5 a.m. each retail open day (Wednesday, Thursday, and Friday), and you can also buy when you arrive without preordering.

node.accessibility_caption: Photo shared by Hill Farmstead Brewery on August 27, 2021 tagging @outrightvermont, and @vermontparksforever. May be an image of one or more people, drink and indoor.

node.text:
September approaches, summer begins its wind down here in the Northeast Kingdom, and we’re looking forward to more moderate days and cooler nights.⁣
⁣
𝘈 𝘤𝘰𝘶𝘱𝘭𝘦 𝘰𝘧 𝘪𝘵𝘦𝘮𝘴 𝘰𝘧 𝘪𝘯𝘵𝘦𝘳𝘦𝘴𝘵 𝘧𝘰𝘳 𝘵𝘩𝘦 𝘤𝘰𝘮𝘪𝘯𝘨 𝘸𝘦𝘦𝘬…⁣
⁣
Beginning with this week’s reservation service and throughout the month of September, we will donate $1 for each draft pour in our taproom to Outright Vermont in support of its invaluable services for at-risk LGBTQ+ youth. September is Vermont Pride month, and Outright Vermont is an essential, state-wide non-profit established in 1989 that works tirelessly to build a safe, equitable state for all LGBTQ+ youth. Follow #drinkitforward for other participating locations and ways you can support the organization (@outrightvermont).⁣
⁣
Also for September, all tips and donation fees from the reservation service will be donated to Vermont Parks Forever, which works to increase access to state parks, provides innovative education, and inspires environmental stewardship throughout Vermont. For more information, visit www.vermontparksforever.org (@vermontparksforever). ⁣
⁣
We will have fresh cans of Citra® Pale Ale (debuting in 16 oz. cans) and Susan, our India Pale Ale. We’ll also continue to offer Edward, our American Pale Ale; Mary (brewed with organic malted barley); Abner, and Society & Solitude #6.⁣
⁣
Bottle shop selections will include Pear: 2020 Harvest; Nonconformist 02; Sankt; Barrel-Aged Lemon Cello and Wachu Saison; as well as an array of other options.⁣
⁣
The same-day order window is available at toasttab.com/hillfarmstead at 5 a.m. each retail open day (Wednesday, Thursday, and Friday), and you can continue to purchase when you arrive without preordering, as well.⁣
⁣
Our taproom will continue with its reservation-only structure, and each Monday, when possible, we’ll open additional reservations. Additional spots generally become available on Monday at 5 p.m. for the same week.⁣
⁣
The refund process for the canceled Friendships and Explorations Festival tickets is available at https://hillfarmstead.com/festival-ticket-refunds/.

node.text:
For this upcoming week, we’ll debut the next in our seasonal fruited Farmstead® Ales: Pear 2020 Harvest. ⁣
⁣
Each harvest season, we choose various barrels of our Farmstead® ales that exhibit sympathetic characteristics for pairing with local fruit varieties. Regardless of the base beer blend, the ideal outcome remains the same: a thoughtful, considerate representation of the fruit in season. In this case, we’ve selected a few barrels to complement the 2020 crop of organic Vermont pears from nearby Elmore Roots Nursery, including five different varieties: Stacey, Summercrisp, Luscious, Nova, and Siberian.⁣
⁣
We will also have three newly canned offerings: Edward, our American Pale Ale; Abner, our Imperial India Pale Ale; and Society & Solitude #6, our Imperial India Pale Ale brewed with Mosaic® hops. We’ll still have cans of Mary (brewed with organic malted barley), as well. Bottle shop selections will include Nonconformist 02; Cherry/Raspberry 2019 Harvest; Sankt; Barrel-Aged Lemon Cello and Wachu Saison; as well as an array of other options.⁣
⁣
We are continuing to refine and troubleshoot our online ordering system to make the ordering, scheduling, and pick-up process more reliable for guests. We appreciate everyone’s patience! Regardless of online ordering status, walk-up, day-of ordering in the bottle shop is available. The same-day order window normally opens on toasttab.com/hillfarmstead at 5 a.m. each retail open day (Wednesday, Thursday, and Friday).⁣
⁣
We continue to evaluate our staffing capacity and weather outlook each Monday and, when possible, open additional reservations for our Taproom experience. Additional spots generally become available on Monday at 5 p.m. for the same week.⁣
⁣
The refund system for returning canceled Festival tickets is available at https://hillfarmstead.com/festival-ticket-refunds/, which includes details for submission. ⁣
⁣
A reminder that if you’re unable to visit us during normal retail hours, stop by Willey’s Store and Wilson Farm Market in Greensboro, Smith’s Grocery in Greensboro Bend, and Buffalo Mountain Coop in Hardwick. We try to maintain a small selection of bottles, and occasionally cans, in these local spots.⁣

node.text:
To celebrate the 10th anniversary of Grassroots Brewing, Shaun traveled out west to Crooked Stave in November 2019 to reimagine and remake two classic Grassroots Brewing beers: Lemon Cello Double IPA and Wachu Saison. The 10th Anniversary barrel-aged iterations of Lemon Cello and Wachu Saison will debut this week in our retail shop.

Originally brewed in 2010 to evoke the popular Italian drink, Limoncello, Lemon Cello was imagined and created for the RateBeer festival in Rome. Crafted from oats, lactose, lemon juice, and lemon zest, and then kettle soured, it was a landmark beer: hopped as if it were a double IPA, sour, citrusy, and with a creamy full body. The new version brewed in Colorado omits the kettle sour—instead opting for mixed culture fermentation in foudres. A portion of that original brew was conditioned for over 15 months in Bourbon barrels from our favorite distillery.  The bourbon barrel version conjures spirited cocktail notes and has internally been referred to as “whiskey sour.” 

Wachu Saison was brewed during the same 2019 trip to Colorado, once again with rice, yuzu, and Szechuan peppercorns. Like Lemon Cello, a portion of this brew was transferred to wine barrels where it conditioned for over 15 months. Both of these beers are bottle conditioned and should age for several years.

A decade later, this reimagining represents a clearer reflection of the original vision and a fresh take on an informative sense memory. Grassroots Brewing was the conceptual precursor to Hill Farmstead Brewery. Over the last decade, it has evolved into a parallel brand and domain for creative collaborations.

Both of these beers will be available at our brewery retail shop, as well as selected locations in Colorado and North Carolina. We hope that you might raise a glass and celebrate ten-plus years with us.

node.accessibility_caption: Photo shared by Hill Farmstead Brewery on August 16, 2021 tagging @lukr.cz. May be an image of drink and indoor.

node.text:
On Wednesday, 18 August, at 5 p.m. EDT, we’ll open up taproom reservations for September. You can click the Reserve button in our profile to look for availability and book your visit.⁣
⁣
Recently, we were able to enable a waitlist feature for those of you unable to secure a reservation, so if space is filled up for your desired day, simply choose “join waitlist” and select your day. If spots open up, the Tock system will notify you in advance. ⁣
⁣
We will continue to evaluate at the beginning of each week, taking into account our staffing levels, the weather, and current COVID circumstances. When possible, we will release additional reservations Monday evenings at 5 for the current week only. While we have ample outdoor space, we carefully consider the variable weekly weather forecast and our capacity to provide the best possible experience for our guests and staff.⁣
⁣
Also, after a long hiatus, Memoria returns this week for taproom guests! Our single-decocted, unfiltered, German-inspired Helles, brewed entirely with organic malt, was cold conditioned for three months in French oak puncheons and then gently, naturally carbonated via fresh krausening Marie. We look forward to sharing it with our reserved taproom guests over the coming weeks. ⁣
⁣
A reminder that we have reinstituted a mask requirement indoors for all visitors and guests, both in the bottle shop and taproom. We appreciate everyone’s easy observance of that last week. ⁣

node.text:
𝘍𝘰𝘳 𝘵𝘩𝘦 𝘸𝘦𝘦𝘬 𝘰𝘧 𝟷𝟾 𝘈𝘶𝘨𝘶𝘴𝘵 𝟸𝟶𝟸𝟷...⁣
⁣
We will have three freshly canned offerings: 𝗘𝗱𝘄𝗮𝗿𝗱, our American Pale Ale; the debut of 16 oz. cans of 𝗗𝗼𝘂𝗯𝗹𝗲 𝗚𝗮𝗹𝗮𝘅𝘆, our single hop Imperial India Pale Ale; and Mary, our German-style lager. This batch of 𝗠𝗮𝗿𝘆 was brewed entirely with certified organic base malts sourced from Germany.⁣
⁣
The bottle shop selections will include Madness & Civilization 13, Nonconformist 01 and 02, Cherry/Raspberry 2019 Harvest, and a number of other options to round out your choices.⁣
⁣
Our online ordering system will be available again beginning Wednesday morning, as normal. We appreciate everyone’s patience with the technical outage we suffered on Friday. Of course, regardless of the vagaries of technology, you can order in the bottle shop when you arrive without ordering ahead as well! The same-day order window opens on toasttab.com/hillfarmstead at 5 a.m. each retail open day.⁣
⁣
When possible, we continue to open up additional reservations each week for our Taproom experience. Additional spots generally become available on Monday at 5 p.m. for the same week after we evaluate our staffing capacity and weather outlook.⁣
⁣
The refund system is now open—both online and onsite—for returning tickets to the cancelled Friendships and Explorations Festival. Please visit https://hillfarmstead.com/festival-ticket-refunds/ for complete details on options and submissions. ⁣
⁣
If you’re unable to visit us during normal retail hours, stop by Willey’s Store and Wilson Farm Market in Greensboro, Smith’s Grocery in Greensboro Bend, and Buffalo Mountain Coop in Hardwick. We try to maintain a small selection of bottles, and occasionally cans, in these local spots.

node.text:
For those who join us this week for our tasting sessions, you will find a singular offering: Still Art.

During the packaging of Art, we occasionally take a small portion of the beer into reserve and package it directly, without the addition of yeast and sugar, allowing the beer to remain still.  We consider it our effort to explore the intersection and parallel universes inhabited by both beer and natural wine. 

In witnessing the unfolding of Still Art simultaneously alongside its conditioning and slowly carbonating sibling,  we are seemingly afforded a rare opportunity to observe and experience two divergent paths of the same base beer: one that is recognizable as Art, evolving for many years with the progression of yeast, sugar, and time; the second is a homologous reflection that recalls the root from which it sprung while offering comparable yet distinct characteristics.

We will make Still Art available onsite, by the glass, from time to time so that guests might experience a different expression of one of our favorite wine barrel-aged Farmstead® ales.

node.text:
𝗥𝗲𝘁𝗮𝗶𝗹 𝗨𝗽𝗱𝗮𝘁𝗲 𝗳𝗼𝗿 𝟭𝟭 𝗔𝘂𝗴𝘂𝘀𝘁 𝟮𝟬𝟮𝟭⁣
⁣
We will release two new bottled beers and have three freshly packaged cans for takeaway this coming week!⁣
⁣
𝗠𝗮𝗱𝗻𝗲𝘀𝘀 & 𝗖𝗶𝘃𝗶𝗹𝗶𝘇𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻 𝗕𝗹𝗲𝗻𝗱 𝟭𝟯⁣
For the thirteenth in our ongoing series of experimental stouts, we selected two barrels of an imperial stout brewed in honor of batch #1,000—a 33º American-style sweet imperial stout that spent more than 28 months in bourbon barrels. The beer was then paired with two different variants of coffee beans grown at Finca Los Rodriguez in Bolivia, sourced and roasted by our longtime friends at The Coffee Collective in Copenhagen. 375ml⁣
⁣
𝗡𝗼𝗻𝗰𝗼𝗻𝗳𝗼𝗿𝗺𝗶𝘀𝘁 𝟬𝟮⁣
The second entry in our new exploratory series began, long ago, as a question: What would a “wild” Mary taste like? Thus, this Farmstead® Lager was brewed with Czech pilsner malt and organic malted wheat in a single decoction and generously hopped with Perle, Hersbrucker, and Czech Saaz.  Primary fermented as a lager with our lager yeast, this was then conditioned in oak barrels for 12 months with our resident microflora.  This has been allowed more than two years of bottle conditioning prior to release. 375ml⁣
⁣
𝗙𝗿𝗲𝘀𝗵 𝗖𝗮𝗻𝘀⁣
This week’s can line up will feature new packagings of Edward, our American Pale Ale; Abner, our Imperial India Pale Ale; and the return of Difference & Repetition: Citra®/Nelson Sauvin, which will be in 6-pack, 12-ounce can format. We will also have cans of Everett; Walden; and Marie.⁣
⁣
Order in the bottle shop when you arrive or, if you wish certainty in selection before you drive, you may order online on the day that you’re planning to visit! The same-day order window opens at 5 a.m. each day.⁣
⁣
For our Taproom experience, we continue to open up additional reservations each week to accommodate more guests. Additional spots become available on Monday at 5 p.m. for the same week.⁣
⁣
If you miss our open retail hours, visit Willey’s Store and Wilson Farm Market in Greensboro, Smith’s Grocery in Greensboro Bend, and Buffalo Mountain Coop in Hardwick. We try to maintain a small selection of bottles, and occasionally cans, in these local spots.

node.accessibility_caption: Photo shared by Hill Farmstead Brewery on July 30, 2021 tagging @yakimachief, and @loftusranches. May be an image of standing and indoor.

node.text:
For this upcoming week, we will have freshly packaged cans of Double Citra. Featuring hand-selected hops from Washington’s Yakima Valley, this beer has made frequent appearances over the last decade.

Our inaugural single-hop beer brewed on Hill Road, in May of 2010, showcased a then-little used variety: Citra®. As the hop’s popularity grew and the qualities of Citra evolved dramatically in those next few years, the original essence became but a fond memory. Years of conversations, much analysis, and hours of on-farm sensory led to a few suitable candidates in 2019 that most closely resembled that original Citra®. It’s with those selections we continue to brew Double Citra today.

Additionally in cans, we will have Edward; Everett; Walden; and Marie. We will also have nearly a dozen bottle offerings available this coming week, including Arthur Cascade; Nonconformist 01; Cherry/Raspberry 2019 Harvest; Civil Disobedience #32; Foudre Florence; and guest bottles from The Lost Abbey and 3 Fonteinen.

As in the before times, you can order in the bottle shop when you arrive, or you might choose to order in advance (online) on the day that you’re planning to visit! The same-day order window opens on toasttab.com/hillfarmstead at 5 a.m. each day.

Continuing the measured evolution of our Taproom experience, we have been able to open up additional reservations for the next few weeks to accommodate more guests. We will make additional spots available on Monday at 5 p.m. for the same week. We expect to open up the last week in August soon!

If you’re visiting the area and miss our open retail hours, check out Willey’s Store and Wilson Farm Market in Greensboro, Smith’s Grocery in Greensboro Bend, and Buffalo Mountain Coop in Hardwick. We try to maintain a small selection of bottles, and occasionally cans, for our immediate local area in these spots.

node.text:
𝗨𝗽𝗱𝗮𝘁𝗲 𝗳𝗼𝗿 𝟮𝟴 𝗝𝘂𝗹𝘆 𝟮𝟬𝟮𝟭⁣
⁣
For this, the last week of July, we will release new presentations for two of our Farmstead® Ales: ⁣
⁣
𝗔𝗿𝘁𝗵𝘂𝗿 𝗖𝗮𝘀𝗰𝗮𝗱𝗲 ⁣
Bottle conditioning since July 2020, this edition of our traditional Farmstead® ale was conditioned in a stainless tank for three months and dry-hopped with the 2020 Cascade Cup Award Winning Cascade grown by Tributary Farms in Yakima Valley. ⁣
⁣
𝗙𝗹𝗼𝗿𝗲𝗻𝗰𝗲 𝗣𝘂𝗻𝗰𝗵𝗲𝗼𝗻⁣
We aged this version of our wheat Farmstead® ale for more than a year in our 500-liter puncheons—not quite Florence, not quite Flora, but magical all the same. This beer has been bottling conditioning since February 2020 and will continue to develop well for the foreseeable future. ⁣
⁣
We will have freshly packaged cans of our American Pale Ale, Edward; our American Porter, Everett; and Walden, our hoppy blond ale brewed with Amarillo®, Motueka™, and Simcoe® hops. First brewed in June 2012 as a collaboration with The Alchemist, we continue to brew Walden each year to remind us of that enduring friendship.⁣
⁣
Our can selection will also include Marie and Harlan, and our wide-ranging bottle offerings will also feature Cherry/Raspberry 2019 Harvest; Civil Disobedience Blend 32; and Nonconformist 01, amongst others. ⁣
⁣
Remember, you can order right in the bottle shop when you arrive, or you can order online on the day that you’re planning to visit! The same-day order window opens at 5 a.m. each day. ⁣
⁣
In order to maintain the quality and balance of our Taproom experience, our Taproom (onsite consumption) will continue to operate on a reservation basis. As we allocate more resources to this experience, we anticipate additional reservation openings to be made available on Monday at 5 p.m.  Please book through our website. ⁣
⁣
If you’re visiting outside of our retail hours, check out Willey’s Store and Wilson Farm Market in Greensboro, Smith’s Grocery in Greensboro Bend, and Buffalo Mountain Coop in Hardwick. We try to maintain a small selection of bottles, and occasionally cans, for our immediate local area in these spots.⁣

node.accessibility_caption: Photo shared by Hill Farmstead Brewery on July 16, 2021 tagging @alexwpeltz, @peltzcreative, and @elmoreroots.

node.text:
𝗕𝗼𝘁𝘁𝗹𝗲 𝗥𝗲𝗹𝗲𝗮𝘀𝗲𝘀 𝗳𝗼𝗿 𝟮𝟭 𝗝𝘂𝗹𝘆 𝟮𝟬𝟮𝟭⁣
⁣
As mentioned in our other post this week, we’ll debut two new beers: ⁣
⁣
𝗡𝗼𝗻𝗰𝗼𝗻𝗳𝗼𝗿𝗺𝗶𝘀𝘁 𝟬𝟭⁣
This brand new series promises to include a wide-ranging assortment of blended beers, exploratory aging techniques, and distinctive ingredient pairings, with imaginative artwork by our life-long friend and collaborator, Alex Peltz of Peltz Creative. For the series debut, we offer Nonconformist 01, a Farmstead® India Pale Ale brewed with organic Maine wheat, organic flaked oats, and generously hopped and then dry-hopped with Citra®, Simcoe®, Mosaic®, and Hallertau Blanc. Conditioned in oak barrels for 11 months, it has been allowed more than two years of bottle conditioning prior to release.⁣
⁣
𝗖𝗵𝗲𝗿𝗿𝘆/𝗥𝗮𝘀𝗽𝗯𝗲𝗿𝗿𝘆: 𝟮𝟬𝟭𝟵 𝗛𝗮𝗿𝘃𝗲𝘀𝘁⁣
As we more fully embrace the characteristics of each fruit that we source, we have somewhat reimagined our fruited Farmstead® ales. To more prominently represent those fruits and the variation of each harvest season, we let the fruit and our learning from past experiences guide us in selecting from our range of barrel-aged Farmstead® ales—sometimes this will be a single base beer, other times it may be a blend of different barrels—all with the goal of best expressing the fruit’s unique aspects. In this instance, we have blended Montmorency cherries from Allenholm in South Hero, Vt., and red raspberries from Elmore Roots in Wolcott, Vt., with a number of sympathetic barrels of Farmstead® ale to provide a thoughtful representation of the fruits in season.⁣
⁣
A reminder that we will also have freshly packaged cans of Harlan, our American India Pale Ale, and Marie, our German-style Helles brewed entirely with organic malt. Please visit our website for more information and links to order.⁣
⁣
Thank you again!⁣

node.text:
𝗥𝗲𝘁𝗮𝗶𝗹 𝗦𝗵𝗼𝗽 𝗡𝗲𝘄𝘀 𝗳𝗼𝗿 𝟮𝟭 𝗝𝘂𝗹𝘆 𝟮𝟬𝟮𝟭⁣
⁣
Thank you to everyone who came out this week for our first week of hybrid retail shop operations. We’re grateful for your patience and positive support all week.⁣
⁣
For clarity, you can order right in the bottle shop when you arrive, or you can order online on the day you’re planning to visit via toasttab.com/hillfarmstead. The same-day order window opens at 5 a.m. each day and beginning this week, you can schedule your pick-up time between 11 a.m. and 5 p.m. ⁣
⁣
If you do order ahead, check in with Courtney or Mike at the register—there is only one line for ordering and order pickup. You can even add to your order when you arrive.⁣
⁣
For this week, we’ll release two new offerings, which we’ll explore more fully in a separate post: ⁣
⁣
Nonconformist 01, a brand new series, and Cherry/Raspberry 2019 Harvest, a reimagined exploration of our fruited Farmstead® ales.⁣
⁣
We will also have freshly packaged cans of our American India Pale Ale, Harlan, and our German-style Helles, Marie. We brewed this new batch of Marie entirely with organic German malt.  Moving forward, we will produce all of our lagers and Farmstead® ales with organic malts and continue working towards fully organic beer throughout. ⁣
⁣
Our can selection will also include Edward; Conduct of Life; and Society & Solitude #6. ⁣
⁣
Our taproom is open by reservation only, and seatings for the remainder of July have filled up; we hope to open up August dates this coming week. Canceled reservations will automatically be added back by the Tock service, and we are reviewing a waiting list feature. Check back there for possible openings.⁣
⁣
Couldn’t get a reservation? Enjoy our beer on tap near the brewery and around northern Vermont by visiting https://hillfarmstead.com/beer-finder/ for locations. Also, if you’re visiting outside of our retail hours, check out Willey’s Store and Wilson Farm Market in Greensboro, Smith’s Grocery in Greensboro Bend, and Buffalo Mountain Coop in Hardwick. We try to maintain a small selection of bottles, and occasionally cans, for our immediate local area.⁣
⁣
Thank you!⁣
